newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso softer on month-end dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso softer on month-end dollar demand.

text.p: The Mexican peso extended earlier softness as corporations began to demand dollars to cover month-end obligations, traders said.

"The peso came under a little pressure straight after the open because the end of the month is coming up. Some corporations are beginning to pick up dollars and are taking advantage of the fact they're cheap," a trader said.
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour counterpart were two and 2.3 centavos weaker, respectively, at 7.8770/7.8800 and 7.8740/7.8770 per dollar.
Same-day peso contracts had meanwhile closed 0.6 of a centavo weaker at 7.8620/7.8650 per dollar.
Dealers said they did not expect the peso to weaken further as activity would decline ahead of the forthcoming long weekend for U.S. financial markets.
